intro: Synotis sciatrephes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf synotis, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Synotis sciatrephes thrives in moist, swampy environments and is often found in marshy areas along riverbanks.
